citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
In April 2024 facility personnel reported that the cleaning/sanitization of 2 NHP primary enclosures had taken place 3 days
over the required once every 2 weeks schedule.
Per this Section, primary enclosures for non-human primates must be sanitized at least once every 2 weeks and as often
as necessary to prevent an excessive accumulation of debris, food waste, excreta, or disease hazards. The research
facility addressed this incident prior to the inspection by implementing corrective measures that included refresher training
to all staff on the required cleaning schedule for NHP primary enclosures and increased monitoring by operations
managers. There have been no additional incidents. To remain corrected from this date 1/29/25 forward.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.
*END OF REPORT*
